column1: Bile acid sequestrants are medicines that help lower your LDL (bad) cholesterol.
Too much cholesterol in your blood can stick to the walls of your arteries and narrow or block them.
These medicines work by blocking bile acid in your stomach from being absorbed in your blood.
Your liver then needs the cholesterol from your blood to make more bile acid.
If this is not successful, medicines to lower the cholesterol may be the next step.
Statins are thought to be the best drugs to use for people who need medicines to lower their cholesterol.
However, some studies show that using other medicines along with statins may not help reduce the risk of heart attack or stroke more than using statins alone.
Certain medicines may interact with bile acid sequestrants.
Taking this medicine may also affect how vitamins and other medications are absorbed in the body.
